business.headline: DA hike before Diwali? Big update for central government employeesDearness Allowance (DA) is revised twice a year, providing employees with financial support that helps maintain their purchasing power as living costs rise.

Gold, silver price today, October 14, 2024: Precious metals witness dip on MCXGold Price Today October 14, 2024: Both gold and silver are trading on the lower side of the Multi Commodity Exchange (MCX) on Monday. Check the latest city-wise prices here.

HDFC Bank shares rise 2% ahead of Q2 results. What should investors do? HDFC Bank share price: Investors are showing increased interest in HDFC Bank shares, anticipating a positive performance in the upcoming quarterly results.
Explained: Why DMart shares plunged 9% in early trade todayThe sharp decline in shares came after DMart's second-quarter earnings failed to meet the market's expectations.
Sensex jumps 500 points, Nifty above 25,000; Wipro, HDFC Bank gain The S&P BSE Sensex was up 409.75 points to 81,791.11 at 10:20 am, while the NSE Nifty50 rose 126.45 points to trade at 25,090.70.

Succession Wars: The Hinduja family's bitter battle for controlAt the heart of the Hinduja family's success was their ethos of shared ownership, but this same principle ultimately sparked their multi-billion dollar feud, endangering an empire built on unity.

Boeing to cut 17,000 jobs as losses deepen amid factory strikeThe planemaker will also delay the delivery of its first 777X jet by a year. Boeing CEO Kelly Ortberg said that the comapny must shrink its workforce "to align with financial reality".

Fortunes soar: India's richest cross $1 trillion mark amid market rallyForbes' analysis shows that India's 100 richest individuals now have a total net worth of $1.1 trillion, more than doubling their wealth since 2019.

From Trent to Titan: Noel Tata's journey to the top of Tata TrustNoel Tata, born to Naval Tata and Simone Tata, has been a key figure in the Tata Group for many years. He holds several senior positions within the conglomerate.

Nariman Point's revival: Office rents expected to nearly double by 2030The report, titled 'South Mumbai – A Renaissance', attributes this expected surge to ongoing infrastructure improvements and rising demand for premium office space in the area.

Noel Tata on being named Tata Trusts Chairman: Will carry on legacy of Ratan TataNoel Tata was named Tata Trusts Chairman after a board meeting held in Mumbai on October 11, where the decision was unanimously agreed upon by the trustees.
Financial crisis looms in Delhi as extra spending tips city into revenue deficitSeveral departments have underscored additional resource needs, which strain the budget further.

Sensex, Nifty end lower as foreign investment fizzles; Tata Group shares gainThe S&P BSE Sensex was down by 230.05 points to close at 81,381.36, while the Nifty50 declined by 34.20 points to end at 24,964.25.
Tata group stocks surge 3% as Noel Tata takes charge at Tata TrustsNoel Tata's appointment came after the death of Ratan Tata, former chairman of Tata Sons, on October 9 at the age of 86.

Appointed Chairman of Tata Trusts, Noel Tata to succeed Ratan Tata Noel Tata has been appointed as the new Chairman of Tata Trusts, effective October 11, following the death of his half-brother Ratan Tata on October 9 at the age of 86.

Who is Noel Tata, new Tata Trusts Chairman and half-brother of Ratan TataNoel Tata has made significant contributions to the Tata Group's growth and success. His strategic vision, coupled with his deep understanding of the group's businesses, has enabled him to play a key role in driving innovation and expanding the group's global reach.

Noel Tata to succeed Ratan Tata, unanimously appointed Chairman of Tata TrustsNoel Tata has been a part of the Tata Group for over 40 years. The appointment was made during a meeting held in Mumbai and was unanimously agreed upon by the board of Tata Trusts.

Mehli Mistry, Noel Tata lead race to become Tata Trusts chairman: ReportNoel Tata is already a trustee in the Sir Dorabji Tata Trust and the Sir Ratan Tata Trust, which together hold a 66% stake in Tata Sons, the holding company of the Tata Group.

Rupee falls to all-time low against dollar amid oil price surgeThe rupee weakened to 83.99 per dollar, slightly surpassing its previous all-time low of 83.9850 recorded on September 12, and down from the 83.9675 level seen in the prior trading session.

Garuda Construction and Engineering IPO allotment: Online guide to check statusGaruda Construction and Engineering IPO allotment: Investors who have bid for the IPO can check their allotment status online. They can log in to either the BSE website or the website of Link Intime India Private Ltd.

entertainment.headline: House of cards actor Kevin Spacey given bail, what happens to #metoo now?From American Beauty to House of Cards, one of the most lauded actors of his generation, Kevin Spacey has a tainted reputation. In a new turn, the Oscar-winning actor "strenuously" denied allegations of sexual assault against him and got bail. Watch to know more

Images of Nayantara wearing sandals inside Tirupati temple sparks outrage against newlywed coupleAfter the grand wedding between Nayantara and Vignesh, the couple went to the Tirupati temple to offer prayers.

However, images of Nayantara wearing footwear inside the temple area has sparked outrage among the devotees against the couple.

While Vignesh was spotted walking barefoot, Nayantara was seen wearing sandals, which caused a massive uproar amongst devotees in the area.

Temple authorities issued a clarification saying it was permitted for devotees to wear footwear in that area.

Cannes Film Festival 2022: Deepika, Aishwarya walk the red carpet; Indian pavilion inauguratedThe 75th annual Cannes Film Festival began on May 17. Aishwarya Rai Bachchan and Deepika Padukone walked the red carpet on Day 3 of the 10-day film festival. 

On the second day, May 18, Union Minister for I&B, Youth Affairs & Sports, Anurag Thakur, inaugurated the India Pavilion at the Cannes Film Festival. The special event was also attended by several Indian celebrities, including Deepika Padukone, R. Madhavan, Nawazuddin Siddiqui, Tamannaah Bhatia and others.

Deepika Padukone, who is part of the Cannes 2022 jury, talked about Indian films at the event and said that she believes there will be a day when Cannes will be in India.
Disco king Bappi Lahiri passes away at 69 Singer-composer Bappi Lahiri passed away on Wednesday, February 16, at a Mumbai hospital. He was 69.

Andheri court summons Shilpa Shetty, Shamita, their mother Sunanda The Andheri court has issued summons to Bollywood actress Shilpa Shetty, her sister Shamita and their mother Sunanda over non-repayment of loan.

general news.headline: Preposterous: India slams Canada's 'person of interest' charge against envoyPreposterous imputations: India on Canada suggesting Indian High Commissioner as 'person of interest' in probe

Target Salman Khan: How Lawrence Bishnoi has tried to terrorise the actorGangster Lawrence Bishnoi's vendetta against Salman Khan, driven by a deep-seated grudge over the blackbuck hunting incident, has manifested in a series of threatening letters and violent attacks, with politician Baba Siddique's murder being the biggest hit so far.

Hundreds protest after 1 killed during Bahraich clashes, internet suspendedUttar Pradesh Chief Minister Yogi Aditynath has taken note of the communal clashes in the state's Bahraich district and called a meeting with senior officials to discuss law and order in the district.

No toll for cars, SUVs entering Mumbai from tonight: Eknath Shinde's big moveAhead of the Maharashtra Assembly polls, Chief Minister Eknath Shinde announced that light motor vehicles need not pay toll at Mumbai's five toll booths.

Satellite pics show new Chinese settlement under construction near Pangong LakeSatellite imagery accessed by India Today shows significant Chinese construction activity, 38 km from the 2020 standoff point, raising fresh concerns over border infrastructure.

Congress Haryana in-charge offers to resign after Assembly polls debacleCongress Haryana in-charge Deepak Babaria tendered his resignation a day after the state Assembly poll results were announced, taking responsibility for the party's poor performance in the recent Haryana elections.

How Hezbollah's drone pierced Israel's Iron DomeA Hezbollah drone hoodwinked Israel's much-vaunted Iron Dome air-defence system late on Sunday and killed four soldiers and injured 60 others. There are two reasons why it is likely that Israel's famed Iron Dome, so effective against rockets, missed the drone fired from Lebanon by Hezbollah.

Protest in Secunderabad after idol vandalised, BJP's Madhavi Latha detainedThe idol at the Muthyalamma temple in Secunderabad was allegedly desecrated, and locals caught the miscreant. A protest was held outside the temple, and BJP leaders who joined the agitation were detained.

What is Lawrence Bishnoi's suraksha kavach?After Delhi and Punjab, the Lawrence Bishnoi gang is making its presence felt in Mumbai. The Bombay underworld was run from abroad after the Bombay blasts of 1993. However, Lawrence Bishnoi has been running his gang from jail with impunity for the last decade. That brings up the question -- what is his suraksha kavach (shield)?

Rajasthan: The Royal Canvas for Dream WeddingsWhether it's the grandeur of a palace wedding in Udaipur, the mystique of a desert wedding in Jaisalmer, or the creativity of a themed wedding in Jaipur, Rajasthan offers a wedding experience that is truly out of the ordinary.

Why Mumbai Police is unable to get gangster Lawrence Bishnoi's custodyLawrence Bishnoi is lodged in Sabarmati Central Jail in Gujarat. His gang has claimed responsibility for the murder of NCP's Baba Siddique.

When Ratan Tata was caught between a CM and militantsIn the late 90s, when militancy was at its peak in Assam, there was a storm in the Tata Tea cup. Then Assam CM Prafulla Kumar Mahanta alleged Tata Group's links with militant outfit Ulfa. Then came the leaked Tata Tapes. This is the time when Ratan Tata led the group through a crisis and emerged unscathed.

Rising cancer rates in India: Mouth and breast cancer cases surgeIndia is grappling with rising cancer rates, especially mouth cancer among men and breast cancer among women, as highlighted by a comparative study by ICMR.

Supreme Court rejects fresh plea in bulldozer action, says matter already closedFollowing a delayed hearing, the Supreme Court on October 1 reserved its judgment on a batch of petitions challenging the use of bulldozers to demolish properties.

Video: Bike turns into fireball after colliding with car in West BengalThe accident occurred when a speeding motorcycle, returning from Durga Puja festivities, collided with a car crossing Delhi Road in Hooghly.

Delhi bans firecrackers till January 1 to fight air pollutionThe Delhi government has announced a complete ban on all types of firecrackers until January 1, 2025, in an effort to curb air pollution. This ban includes the manufacturing, storage and selling of all firecrackers in the national capital.

Hina Khan nearing last cycle of chemotherapy, posts pic of 'last standing eyelash'Actor Hina Khan shared her experience of losing eyelashes due to chemotherapy. She remains positive, using her "last standing eyelash" as motivation and wearing 'falsies' for shoots.

DA hike before Diwali? Big update for central government employeesDearness Allowance (DA) is revised twice a year, providing employees with financial support that helps maintain their purchasing power as living costs rise.
Genetics and food: The science behind premature hair loss in menPremature hair loss in men is commonly linked to various factors including genetics, diet and lifestyle.

Govt releases high risk warning for Google Chrome and AndroidThe Indian government has warned users about high-risk vulnerabilities in Google Chrome and Android. Users are urged to update their systems immediately to prevent potential cyber threats.

Aishwarya-Abhishek's candid family moment in Anant Ambani's wedding documentaryThe documentary Valley of Gods, Jamnagar showcases Anant Ambani and Radhika Merchant's Hastakshar Ceremony. It features Bollywood stars like Abhishek and Aishwarya Bachchan.

Baba Siddique murder: Dossier reveals mastermind Zeeshan Akhtar's involvementBaba Siddique, a 66-year-old NCP leader, was shot dead outside his office in Mumbai's Bandra during Dussehra celebrations on October 12.

Video: McDonald's worker fails to recognise Bill Clinton. What happened nextWhile campaigning for Democratic presidential candidate Kamala Harris in Georgia, former President Bill Clinton stepped into a McDonald's, only to find the employee at the counter failing to recognise him.

Two people communicated in their dreams, scientists claim experiment successfulA California-based startup, REMspace, claimed that it succeeded in an experiment involving two individuals who communicated in their dreams on September 24.

Vijay 69: Anupam Kher's film to release on Netflix on November 8Vijay 69, a Netflix and YRF Entertainment film, stars Anupam Kher as a 69-year-old challenging age stereotypes by training for a triathlon. This inspiring narrative blends humour and emotion, emphasising that age is no barrier to dreams.

Suriya's Kanguva to be dubbed in multiple languages using AI: ProducerTamil actor Suriya's eagerly anticipated Kanguva will soon release in cinemas. Ahead of the release, its producer confirmed that the actor's voice would be dubbed in multiple languages using Artificial Intelligence.

Watch: Kajol hilariously calls herself 'asli Singham' at Do Patti trailer launchActor Kajol entertained the audience at the trailer launch of Do Patti, and referred to her husband, actor Ajay Devgn's famous cop character - Singham, during the event.

Bigg Boss 18: Karan Veer Mehra clarifies allegations of assaulting ex-wivesKaran Veer Mehra addressed allegations of physical violence against his ex-wives during the latest episode of Bigg Boss 18. Host Salman Khan also questioned him about whether any police reports had been filed against him.

iQOO 13 render leaks, shows back camera design with RGB light around itThe iQOO 13 has been in the spotlight recently, with new render leaks showcasing a striking design feature. Images surfacing on the Chinese platform Weibo reveal the back of the smartphone.

OnePlus 13 launching in October end: Everything we know so farThe OnePlus 13 is anticipated to launch by late October, boasting significant upgrades like the Snapdragon 8 Elite chipset and enhanced battery life, likely setting new standards in the flagship smartphone market.

MacBook Air M1 is available under Rs 60,000 on AmazonAmazon is offering a great deal on the MacBook Air M1 model. The laptop is currently available under Rs 60,000, making it the cheapest MacBook ever from Apple.

IMC 2024: Xiaomi-Snapdragon partnership, Meta Ray Ban and everything expectedIndia Mobile Congress (IMC) 2024 is scheduled to kick off tomorrow, October 15, and will go on till Friday, October 18. Some big announcements are expected from Xiaomi and Qualcomm at the event. Here is everything you can expect.

sports.headline: Gautam Gambhir backs 'ever-hungry' Virat Kohli to find form in New Zealand TestsHead coach Gautam Gambhir, speaking to the press in Bengaluru on his 43rd birthday, said he is confident that Virat Kohli will return to peak form in the upcoming three-Test series against New Zealand. Kohli has not hit a fifty in three Tests played in 2024.

PAK vs ENG: Ben Stokes returns as England make 2 changes for 2nd TestBen Stokes has returned to the playing XI as England announced their team for the second Test against Pakistan in Multan, which will begin from October 15, Tuesday. Stokes is one of the 2 changes made by England for the match.

Who is Sam Konstas? Batting prodigy in contention for Australian opening spot19-year-old Sam Konstas has been called up for the tour games against India. Konstas who has played just 5 first-class matches so far comes in with a lot of promise and is one of the wildcards for the vacant opening position in the Australian Test team.

PAK vs ENG: Shaheen Afridi breaks silence after Pakistan axePakistan fast bowler Shaheen Shah Afridi broke his silence with a short tweet after getting dropped from the Test team. Shaheen was one among 4 Pakistan players rested for the 2nd and 3rd Test matches vs England.

Ranji Trophy: Defending champions Mumbai stunned by Baroda in opening roundBhargav Bhatt rocked the Mumbai batting order with a six-wicket haul in the second innings as Baroda stunned the defending champions to win the first round match by 82 runs on October 14, Monday.

Ranji Trophy: Tamil Nadu hand Jaydev Unadkat's Saurashtra innings defeatTamil Nadu beat Saurashtra by an innings and 70 runs in Round 1 of the Ranji Trophy. Medium pacer Gurjapneet Singh ran through the Saurashtra batting order to hand them a heavy defeat.

Babar Azam dropped: Nasser Hussain says England won't mind Pakistan's callNasser Hussain feels that England would be pleased to have seen Pakistan drop Babar Azam for the remainder of the Test series on Sunday, October 13. Babar has been struggling with his form in Tests.

Ranji Trophy: Easwaran continues Test team push with century vs UPRanji Trophy: Abhimanyu Easwaran continued to knock on the door of the Indian Test team with a century against Uttar Pradesh in the first Ranji Trophy match of the season. This was Easwaran's 4th hundred in the last 4 games.

Shashi Tharoor welcomes Sanju Samson with 'ponnada' in ThiruvananthapuramCongress MP Shashi Tharoor presented Sanju Samson with a blue shawl after the superstar wicketkeeper returned to Thiruvananthapuram.  Samson hit his maiden T20I hundred on Saturday in Hyderabad in India's record-breaking win over Bangladesh.

Pawan Sehrawat Telugu Titans' hope for revival in season 11After struggling in the past few seasons, Telugu Titans will be looking at Pawan Sehrawat to lead their revival in season 11 of the Pro Kabaddi League this year.

Djokovic ends 2024 without Grand Slam, calls it his 'worst-performing season'Legendary Novak Djokovic has called the 2024 season as one of his worst-performing ones. Djokovic finished 2024 without a single Grand Slam but won the Olympic gold medal by beating Carlos Alcaraz.

Samson hit his maiden T20I hundred on Saturday in Hyderabad in India's record-breaking win over Bangladesh.

Djokovic ends 2024 without Grand Slam, calls it his 'worst-performing season'Legendary Novak Djokovic has called the 2024 season as one of his worst-performing ones. Djokovic finished 2024 without a single Grand Slam but won the Olympic gold medal by beating Carlos Alcaraz.

England interim manager Lee Carsley remains coy on taking full-time jobEngland's interim boss Lee Carsley has remained coy about taking the full-time job after their UEFA Nations League win over Finland on Sunday, October 13. Carsley has lost just one game since taking over from Gareth Southgate.

Steve Smith will not open in Test series vs India: George BaileyAustralia batter Steve Smith will not open the innings vs India, confirmed Australia chief selector George Bailey. The announcement comes nearly a month ahead of the first Test match of the Border Gavaskar Trophy.

Hasan Ali backs 'brothers' Babar, Shaheen and Naseem after Pakistan axeHasan Ali has backed 'brothers' and 'champions' Babar Azam, Shaheen Shah Afridi and Naseem Shah to bounce back after the trio was dropped from the Pakistan squad for the remainder of the England Test series on Sunday, October 13.

Babar Azam vs Virat Kohli comparisons are baseless: Brad HoggFormer Australia spinner Brad Hogg shunned comparisons between Babar Azam and Virat Kohli after the former was dropped from the Pakistan Test side. Hogg said that dropping Babar was the right call from Pakistan.

UEFA Nations League: England return to winning ways with 3-1 Finland winEngland bounced back from their loss against Greece with a convincing 3-1 win over Finland in the UEFA Nations League on October 13, Sunday. The Three Lions won the match 3-1 to get their campaign back on track.

Pat Cummins returns as captain as Australia announce ODI squad vs PakistanAustralia Test and ODI captain Pat Cummins return after his break as the world champions named their ODI squad against Pakistan. Australia will take on Pakistan in a 3-match ODI series.

Wish Pakistan all the best against New Zealand: India coach Amol MuzumdarIndia coach Amol Muzumdar sent his best wishes to Pakistan ahead of their clash against New Zealand on Monday, October 14. The Indian team will need a favour from Pakistan if they have to qualify for the semifinals of the Women's T20 World Cup 2024.

India can still qualify for semis after Australia loss. Here's howWomen's T20 World Cup 2024: India lost to Australia by nine runs in Sharjah on Sunday, but Harmanpreet Kaur's women are still in with a chance of making their way through to the semi-final.

UEFA Nations League: England return to winning ways with 3-1 Finland winEngland bounced back from their loss against Greece with a convincing 3-1 win over Finland in the UEFA Nations League on October 13, Sunday. The Three Lions won the match 3-1 to get their campaign back on track.

Pat Cummins returns as captain as Australia announce ODI squad vs PakistanAustralia Test and ODI captain Pat Cummins return after his break as the world champions named their ODI squad against Pakistan. Australia will take on Pakistan in a 3-match ODI series.

Wish Pakistan all the best against New Zealand: India coach Amol MuzumdarIndia coach Amol Muzumdar sent his best wishes to Pakistan ahead of their clash against New Zealand on Monday, October 14. The Indian team will need a favour from Pakistan if they have to qualify for the semifinals of the Women's T20 World Cup 2024.

India can still qualify for semis after Australia loss. Here's howWomen's T20 World Cup 2024: India lost to Australia by nine runs in Sharjah on Sunday, but Harmanpreet Kaur's women are still in with a chance of making their way through to the semi-final.

IND vs AUS: Cameron Green out of Border Gavaskar Trophy, sidelined for 6 monthsAustralia suffered a big blow ahead of the Border Gavaskar Trophy as Cameron Green has been ruled out of the 5-match Test series against India. Cricket Australia confirmed the news on October 14, Monday with Green set to undergo surgery and be on the shelf for 6 months.

Harmanpreet Singh, Hardik Singh attract big bids on HIL auction Day 1 The Hockey India League 2024/25 Auction saw Indian stars and international talents attract record-breaking bids, with franchises spending Rs 16.88 crore on 54 players, highlighting the demand for top drag-flickers and goalkeepers on Day 1.

Pakistan Board disgruntled with Fakhar Zaman for questioning Babar Azam's removalPakistan Cricket Board (PCB) is unhappy with Fakhar Zaman's post on his X account questioning the removal of star batter Babar Azam from the squad of the ongoing Test series against England.

Australia don't depend on one or two people: Harmanpreet after India's lossIndia captain Harmanpreet Kaur criticised her team's lack of collective effort following their 9-run defeat to Australia, highlighting this as the key difference between the sides in a crucial Women's T20 World Cup clash.

education.headline: The role of data analytics in modern advertising educationThis transformation also exercises a significant impact on the realm of 'advertising education.'

NCERT deletes Azad Pak, adds China's aggression reference in Class 12 textbookThe NCERT has made final changes to its Class 12 Political Science textbook syllabus for the upcoming academic year, including a revision in reference to India's border situation with China, Azad Pakistan, Article 370 and more.

NEET row: Bihar cops find 6 post-dated cheques 'issued for question paper brokers'Six post-dated cheques which were suspected to have been issued in favour of mafia demanding over Rs 30 lakh from each candidate seeking alleged leaked question paper ahead of NEET held last month were recovered by Bihar Police.

Forest fires surge tenfold from 2004 to 2017: Causes, impact and preventionAmidst a relentless surge, intense forest fires are now multiplying tenfold, casting a menacing shadow over our flora and fauna. Year by year, their fiery grip tightens, threatening ecosystems far and wide, now extending their reach to impact human lives.

Fresh plea in Supreme Court to recall NEET results, reconduct examsA fresh petition has been filed in the Supreme Court to recall the National Entrance cum Eligibility Test - Under Graduate (NEET-UG) 2024 results and re-conduct fresh examination after discrepancies in the declared results.

NTA issues clarification after NEET result controversy over toppers, high cut-offIn a detailed statement, the National Testing Agency (NTA) said that the increase in cut-off and number of toppers in the NEET-UG reflect the competitive nature of the exam and maintained that the test's integrity has not been compromised.

Exclusive: Arvind Kejriwal claims 'BJP succession war, PM backing Amit Shah'Speaking exclusively to India Today TV, Delhi Chief Minister Arvind Kejriwal claimed that there is a "succession war" within the BJP. He also claimed that the ruling party is "not fighting the Lok Sabha elections as a team".

4 medical students arrested in Bihar for appearing as proxies for NEET aspirantsFour MBBS students who appeared in place of NEET aspirants in the medical entrance exam were detained in Bihar's Purnea.

NEET-UG question paper not leaked, claims baseless: National Testing AgencyThe reports claiming question paper leak in the medical entrance exam NEET-UG are "completely baseless and without any ground", the National Testing Agency (NTA) has clarified.
The generation with answers: Tech-savvy Indian youth tackling global challengesIndia's tech-savvy youth rewriting the global narrative, one solution at a time.

Left sweeps JNU students' polls, Dhananjay is first Dalit presidentThe Left swept the Jawaharlal Nehru University Students' Union (JNUSU) polls, winning all four posts and trouncing the RSS-affiliated ABVP. The ABVP was leading at one point, but the Left eventually surged ahead and emerged victorious.
The power of knowledge: Education's influence on real estate market trendsIn a dynamic sector like real estate, investing in continuing education is not simply an option; it is a requirement.

JNU students' body election on March 22 after 4 yearsThe Jawaharlal Nehru University Students' Union (JNUSU) polls will take place on March 22, more than four years after the last elections were held in September 2019.

UP 12th board exam math, biology papers leaked on WhatsApp, complaint filedThe mathematics and biology question papers for the Uttar Pradesh class 12 board exam were allegedly leaked on a WhatsApp group.

UP Police Constable recruitment exam cancelled days after paper leakThe Uttar Pradesh Police Constable recruitment exam held on February 17 and 18 was canceled due to a paper leak. The Chief Minister has announced a re-examination within the next six months.
Jawaharlal Nehru University: Brains trustTeaching and research go hand in hand at the institute which is proud of its activist tradition.
